content.description: Devils lake southshore bouldering area- there is a bathroom, to the right if you're looking at the boulders from the parking lot. Around the back there is a door with an overhanging roof. SDS climb up the door hindges, and work your way under the roof using either of the 4x4 supports,(light is off) throw for the roof, and hold on. after that, heel hook and mantle. if you miss you land flat on your back. Crazy route!

The bridge where the railroad crosses Broadway (just down the road from Conways) has some splitter cracks going up the cement abutments.  The Pool side crack accepts fingers, though the cement is pretty sharp. Tape is recomended, as is a lookout for the prowling cop cars at bar time.

The bridge where the railroad crosses Broadway (just down the road from Conways) has some splitter cracks going up the cement abutments. The Conway's side crack is very thin and very hard.  Tape is recomended, as is a lookout for the prowling cop cars at bar time.
A couple comments were posted on buildering routes in the Baraboo Area, so I think it's appropriate to give them a rightful spot in the routes datbase.
